news_header: Election officials plan to recalculate about 14% of votes amid allegations of fraud.
news_text: Approximately 14% of the votes from the recent elections will be recalculated by election officials, who are responding to allegations of significant election fraud by the opposition. The recalculation will involve randomly selecting five voting stations from each constituency. The Georgian Dream party won the election with 54% of the votes, while the Western opposition coalition received 37.5%.
